name: Pillars Fund
mission: Pillars Fund amplifies the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all.
theoryOfChange: Pillars Fund explicitly states its mission to "amplify the leadership, narratives, and talents of Muslims in the United States to advance opportunity and justice for all." They are focused on "narrative and cultural power — tapping into a rich inheritance of Muslim storytelling to transform society." This approach is further detailed as a "long-term narrative and culture change strategy for and with the American Muslim community." Their work involves supporting nonprofit organizations and creative leaders who are building narrative and cultural power for social change, and they have initiatives like the Pillars Artist Fellowship to empower creatives to tell their own stories. This demonstrates a clear, documented program strategy linking their activities to their overarching goals and desired impact.
zakatClaimEvidence: Pillars Fund is described as a grant-making organization and Muslim community foundation focused on funding secular non-profit programs supporting American Muslims. There is no explicit mention on their website or in the provided search results that they accept zakat donations from individuals or have dedicated zakat funds. (Source: https://pillarsfund.secure.nonprofitsoapbox.com/donate-to-pillars-fund)

The organization operates as a bridge between the Muslim community and mainstream cultural institutions, aiming to <cite id="2">reshape cultural narratives</cite> through direct investment in creators and nonprofit leaders. In 2023, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,398,957</cite>, with a significant focus on high-impact program delivery. Their model is built on <cite id="4">capacity building and multimedia contributions</cite>, ensuring that Muslim voices are authentically represented in the American public square. Key initiatives include the <cite id="5">Pillars Artist Fellowship and Media Labs</cite>, which provide resources to creators to challenge stereotypes. Despite a <cite id="6">3-year revenue CAGR of -53.4%</cite>, the organization maintains a very strong financial cushion, holding <cite id="7">20.7 months of working capital</cite> to sustain its operations during funding fluctuations. This high liquidity allows Pillars Fund to remain a stable partner for the <cite id="8">fellows and nonprofit organizations</cite> it supports across the United States.
